Pre-Game Insights: Oklahoma City Thunder is looking to continue its five-game win streak with a victory against Memphis Grizzlies.
The Thunder are 16-5 in conference play and rank seventh in the Western Conference with 33.8 defensive rebounds per game led by Isaiah Hartenstein averaging 9.9.
The Grizzlies are 9-7 in Western Conference play and rank sixth in the NBA with 12.7 offensive rebounds per game led by Zach Edey averaging 3.7.
The Thunder make 46.4% of their shots from the field this season, which is 2.5 percentage points higher than the Grizzlies have allowed to their opponents (43.9%).
The Grizzlies average 14.2 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.6 more made shots on average than the 12.6 per game the Thunder give up.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is averaging 30.8 points, 5.6 rebounds, 6.1 assists and two steals for the Thunder.
Santi Aldama is averaging 13 points and 7.3 rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Others: Thunder's last 10 games: 10-0, averaging 116.8 points, 46.2 rebounds, 25.6 assists, 12.3 steals and 5.1 blocks per game while shooting 47.5% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 101.6 points per game.

Grizzlies' last 10 games: 8-2, averaging 129.6 points, 50.7 rebounds, 30.9 assists, 10.5 steals and 5.7 blocks per game while shooting 48.6% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 114.7 points.

Injuries for Thunder: Cason Wallace (day to day, quadriceps), Chet Holmgren (out, hip), Luguentz Dort (day to day, ankle), Branden Carlson (day to day, concussion protocol), Nikola Topic (out for season, ACL), Alex Caruso (day to day, hip).

Injuries for Grizzlies: Marcus Smart (out, finger), Brandon Clarke (day to day, knee), Santi Aldama (out, ankle), Vince Williams Jr. (out, ankle), Ja Morant (out, AC joint), GG Jackson II (out, foot).
